DOC.brief_summary: CYP51 is an enzyme essential for fungal growth. Inhibition of CYP51 results in the accumulation of compounds toxic to the fungus. CYP51 is the target of the class of drugs referred to as 'azole antifungals'. The lack of selectivity by the azole antifungals is responsible for many of the side effects associated with these drugs. VT-1161 has been design to be safer and more active against the fungal species typically responsible for vaginal yeast infections (i.e. vulvovaginal candidiasis)
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate Oral VT-1161 in the Treatment of Patients With Acute Vaginal Candidiasis (Yeast Infection)
DOC.criteria: Key Females ≥18 and <65 years Clinical diagnosis of symptomatic acute VVC Positive KOH .At least one vulvovaginal sign (vulvovaginal erythema, edema, or excoriation). At least one vulvovaginal symptom (vulvovaginal itching, burning, or irritation) A minimum composite vulvovaginal signs and symptoms score of ≥6 must be be able to swallow capsules Evidence of major organ system disease History of cervical cancer History of diabetes mellitus Pregnant Recent use of systemic antifungal drugs or systemic antimicrobial therapy for any reason Recent use of drugs to treat vaginal infections Recent use of immunosuppressive therapies
